metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5699 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
CRLF injection vulnerability in the HTTPConnection.putheader function inurllib2 and urllib in CPython (aka Python) before 2.7.10 and 3.x before3.4.4 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary HTTP headers via CRLFsequences in a URL.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5699` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.3
libpython2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.3
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.3
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.3
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.3
python2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.3
python2.7-examples - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.3
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

idle-python3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.5
libpython3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.5
libpython3.4-minimal - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.5
libpython3.4-stdlib - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.5
libpython3.4-testsuite - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.5
python3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.5
python3.4-examples - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.5
python3.4-minimal - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.5
python3.4-venv - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.6-8ubuntu0.3').
python3.4 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.5').
python3.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
